column8: Francisco Goya and Roy Lichenstein are two of my favourite artists and I wanted to create a design that incorporated both of their styles.  The hanging torsos are taken from Goya's plate 39 from The Disasters of War (1810-1820) and the donkey's head is taken from Goya's print Los Caprichos, Plate 39.  Goya's nightmarish etchings appear comic like and contemporary due to the bright colours and Benday dot effect, the signature style of Lichtenstein.
